meanings.definition: A person or thing that toggles.
meanings.sent1: The toggler pressed the button to make the light turn on.
meanings.sent2: I am the toggler who can switch the TV channels.
meanings.sent3: The toggler, a master of switches, was invited to the party for entertainment.
meanings.sent4: She was a toggler, effortlessly shifting between tasks like a skilled juggler.
meanings.sent5: The toggler, with quick hands and sharp eyes, controlled the flow of electricity.

meanings.definition: A switch or lever that is used to turn a device on or off.
meanings.sent1: The toggler on the wall controls the fan in the room.
meanings.sent2: Please flip the toggler to start the machine.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the toggler, turning the lights on and off.
meanings.sent4: With a flick of the toggler, the room was plunged into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The old toggler creaked as it was pushed up to activate the alarm system.

meanings.definition: A feature in a software program that allows users to switch between options or settings.
meanings.sent1: The toggler on the screen lets you change the font size.
meanings.sent2: Click the toggler to enable the night mode.
meanings.sent3: The toggler in the app made it easy to switch to dark mode for bedtime reading.
meanings.sent4: She found the toggler in the menu, like a secret passage to different settings.
meanings.sent5: By clicking the toggler, you can quickly switch between languages on the website.
